p: We also focused on dynamical relations that describe processes that refer to acceleration and deceleration vis-a-vis SD. For instance, the acceleration of techno-scientific innovation for climate change mitigation and adaptation is one such process. The deceleration of technical products’ obsolescence rates and private consumerism are examples of a second temporal process. The method of temporal classification of prevalent processes is standard and crucial in complex systems analysis (Simon 2002; Walker et al. 2012). Moreover, studying temporal diversity may lead to operationalizing conceptual models and is important in addressing sustainability problems. This is recognized for example in the fields of sustainable chemistry and health services (Weiser et al. 2017; Sarriot and Kouletio 2015; Cash et al. 2006).
